column9: I have severe chronic back pain from spondylosis, bulging disk and a ruptured disk with bone spurs up and down my spine and had been on MS Contin, but it stopped working as does any drug that I've taken for 5-6 months and though this seems to be working for now, it doesn't usually last until the next dose.

column2: back pain, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: had taken several types of pain medication including the patch and still use the patch but by taking one of these with the patch I am able to sleep six to seven hours without having severe pain. This is a blessing.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had neck surgery and it works wonders... I think this is by far the best pain relief I have had since my injury in December of 2007

column2: justscrapping, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medicine works much better than vicodin type medications "hydrocodone" but i have really bad itching if i take more than 1 10mg.  The itching drives me crazy.  It's worth it i guess to get rid of the pain but OMG the itching......

column2: lennongirl80, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have osteoaritis in my back from a prolonged injury as well as degenerative disk disease. I have tried several narcotic pain relievers and this one worked the best. I did experience dizziness and nausea at first but, after I began taking it on a regular basis, those sypmtoms seem to disapate. I find that eating a small meal or snack wipes out all chances of the nausea. I am satisfied with this drug.
